channel.title: Help removing npc
channel.description:
I'm using the RSCA source. There is a "shifty looking man" behind the Edgeville bank and I wish to remove him. I searched NPCloc thoroughly several times and I am confident he is not there. Where else could the files on him be?
Also, does anyone have an object id list? Like trees, portals, benches, etc? I have this one, http://jamili.da3rx.com/rsc/objects.html, but it would be nice if there was one with pictures! If there isn't one then I might make one for the community.
EDIT: It was the event token npc and his id says 24 but is actually 802 in the NPCLoc file.
SOLVED

item.title: Help removing npc
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:2, topic:478168”]I don’t think anyone has made an objects list with any pictures, not that I know of anyway. But what would be really cool is if you dumped the actual models with their correct sprites/colours and had some JavaScript script to make them viewable in a browser.
To get you started, here’s a wiki page on the OB3 format written by .S. (I can’t remember his forum name): http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=OB3[/quote]Yeah I got dumps from imthenull and used a viewer in Javascript. Worked out pretty well :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Help removing npc
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

You could always make a command that just starts placing the objects in 1 spot and keeps changing it. Then, have a command that stops it and tells you the id of the current object.

If you still want to make a list, you could use the above along with a client that takes screenshots of the object when it changes (you should be able to write a script for an existing bot that does this).

Read full topic

item.title: Help removing npc
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

That definitely sounds like something I’d love to do in the future. I think it’s a bit over my head right now though. =\

Read full topic

item.title: Help removing npc
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

I don’t think anyone has made an objects list with any pictures, not that I know of anyway. But what would be really cool is if you dumped the actual models with their correct sprites/colours and had some JavaScript script to make them viewable in a browser.
To get you started, here’s a wiki page on the OB3 format written by .S. (I can’t remember his forum name): http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=OB3

Read full topic
